title: Chelsea planning new Nemanja Matic contract to reward key role in team that's closing in on the title
text:
Sport Chelsea planning new Nemanja Matic contract to reward key role in team that's closing in on the title The champions-elect are looking at Tiemoue Bakayoko and Franck Kessie to boost their midfield but the Serb remains vital Share Matic has been restored to the side by new boss Antonio Conte — and Chelsea are back on top (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Chelsea are set to open talks with midfield enforcer Nemanja Matic over a new contract this summer. 
The Blues ' boss Antonio Conte sees the 28-year-old as an important part of his plans, despite targeting reinforcements ahead of next season. 
Monaco’s Tiemoue Bakayoko and Franck Kessie of Atalanta are both on the radar, after Radja Nainggolan opted to remain with Roma in the summer 2016 window after being pursued by the Londoners. 
But Conte has been delighted with the contribution of Matic, who is back to being a key player and has Chelsea within touching distance of a second Premier League title in three seasons. Monaco's Bakayoko is on the Chelsea hit-list for this summer's window (Photo: Getty) Kessie is another midfielder they are looking at as Champions League return looms (Photo: Rex Features) Read More 
Chelsea re-signed Matic, who has been their player from August 2009 to January 2011, from Portuguese giants Benfica for £21million three years ago and handed him a five-and-a-half year deal. 
He was rewarded for his impressive form under then-boss Jose Mourinho with a pay-rise a year later. 
But the Serb was left out of the team by Guus Hiddink in the second half of last season, after Mourinho's December sacking. 
The Blues' interim boss preferred Jon Obi Mikel, who has now left the club for China's Tianjin TEDA. Read More
